channel.title: BBC News - Home
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Israel sets March deadline for Gaza ground offensive in Rafah
item.description: A war cabinet member says unless Hamas frees all hostages by 10 March an assault will begin in Rafah.

item.title: Murder arrest after three young children found dead in Bristol
item.description: A 42-year-old woman is held after three young children are found dead at a house in Bristol.

item.title: Gaza doctors: ‘We leave patients to scream for hours and hours’
item.description: Doctors in Gaza say the healthcare system is broken and they are operating on people without anaesthetic.

item.title: Bristol: Two boys charged with murder of Darrian Williams
item.description: The 15-year-olds are charged with the murder of 16-year-old Darrian Williams in Bristol.

item.title: Oppenheimer's Cillian Murphy and Robert Downey Jr scoop Bafta Film Awards
item.description: Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr and Christopher Nolan all win Bafta Film Awards for Oppenheimer.

item.title: Papua New Guinea ambush: More than 50 shot dead in Highlands region
item.description: The country has long struggled with tribal violence, but the killings are believed to be the worst in years.

item.title: Kemi Badenoch in row with former Post Office chairman
item.description: Business secretary says claims made by Henry Staunton over his dismissal are a "misrepresentation".

item.title: Sir Keir Starmer calls for Gaza 'ceasefire that lasts'
item.description: The Labour leader responds to pressure over his stance on a ceasefire ahead of a Commons vote.

item.title: Leicester: Major search after two-year-old boy falls into river
item.description: The child was with his family when he fell into the River Soar near Aylestone on Sunday, police say.

item.title: Alexei Navalny: US and UK ambassadors to Russia lay tributes
item.description: Diplomats in Moscow pay their respects to the Russian opposition leader who died in prison on Friday.

item.title: Israel condemns Brazil's Lula likening Gaza war to Holocaust
item.description: Brazil's president is accused by Israel of "crossing a red line" after he made the comparison in a speech.

item.title: Online campaign seeks Easter Island statue's return from British Museum
item.description: A campaign by social media users in Chile seeks the repatriation of Hoa Hakananai'a moai to the island.

item.title: Luton's Taylor Swift moment? Harry Styles pops up in Kenilworth Road crowd
item.description: Fans joke that the star's appearance is the UK version of Taylor Swift at the Super Bowl.

item.title: Navalny's life and future death captured in Oscar-winning documentary
item.description: The director of the 2022 Oscar-winning film speaks of his shock at the death of Alexei Navalny.

item.title: Dog attacks: What can you do to protect yourself?
item.description: The best course of action will vary depending on the situation, dog behaviour experts explain.

item.title: Influential names among those rejected for new Overground lines
item.description: TfL spoke to historians and delved into archives to seek inspiration for new line names.

item.title: Conjoined twins given days to live are proving world wrong
item.description: Marieme and Ndeye, seven, were not expected to survive for more than a few days after they were born.

item.title: West Africa’s Michelin-starred cuisine wows London
item.description: African fine dining is often overlooked, but now restaurants are getting their just deserts.

item.title: A US sailor killed two near Tokyo - why is Japan asked to apologise?
item.description: The early release of Ridge Alkonis, who killed two in a car accident, stirs unease over US-Japan relations.

item.title: UN: Asylum seekers report assault and self-harm on remote UK island
item.description: A group of 61 held in a camp on Diego Garcia tell UN inspectors of sexual assaults, rat bites and self-harm.

item.title: Fearless Nadia: The Australian stuntwoman who captivated Indians
item.description: Known by her stage name Fearless Nadia, Mary Ann Evans ruled the Indian box office in the 1930s and 40s.

item.title: Kerrang TV: How a channel shaped the alternative music scene
item.description: Channel 4, which owns the channel, says it will soon be "unprofitable" due to declining audiences.

item.title: Dungeons & Dragons at 50: How the fantasy world can be a home for everyone
item.description: D&D has been popping up across popular culture, including Stranger Things and Baldur's Gate 3.

item.title: Matt Smith on if he'd return to Doctor Who and being Prince Harry's 'grandad'
item.description: The actor recalls when he spoke to the Duke of Sussex about playing his grandfather in The Crown.

item.title: Steve Wright's Sunday Love Songs goes on air 'without the chief'
item.description: The Radio 2 show opens with a tribute to DJ Steve Wright, its long-time host, who died this week.

item.title: Shane Rose: Show jumper competes in mankini
item.description: Australian three-time Olympic medallist Shane Rose is stood down from competition for wearing a mankini during a show jumping event.

item.title: What happened to Westminster's famous pub division bell?
item.description: The chimes that tell MPs in pubs it is time to vote seem to be dying out.

item.title: No discussion over Falklands sovereignty, says Lord Cameron
item.description: Ahead of his visit, the foreign secretary says the Islands will be British as long as they want to be.

item.title: Sacked Twitter staff in Ghana finally get pay-off
item.description: Former workers at X's Africa base say they have got their severance pay after a year-long campaign.

item.title: Nansledan: Prince William to build homes for homeless on Duchy land
item.description: The Duchy of Cornwall announces plans to build accommodation for homeless in Newquay.

item.title: WHO says Gaza's Nasser hospital not functional after Israel raids
item.description: Israeli forces say intelligence suggested hostages were being held at the Nasser site by Hamas.

item.title: Tel Aviv protesters call on Netanyahu to resign
item.description: The Israeli prime minister's popularity has declined among Israelis after the 7 October Hamas attacks.

item.title: Thaksin Shinawatra: Former Thai prime minister released on parole
item.description: Thaksin Shinawatra, one of Thailand's most divisive figures, was convicted last year on corruption charges.

item.title: Ukraine visa schemes to be extended by 18 months
item.description: It means those on the earliest visas will be allowed to stay in the UK until at least September 2026.

item.title: Donald Trump launches own-brand shoes after $355m fraud fine
item.description: The ex-president promoted gold-coloured shoes priced at $399 at a sneaker convention in Philadelphia.

item.title: West Bank Palestinians paying the price for Gaza war
item.description: Kamal, from the occupied West Bank, had a well-paid job in Israel before the Hamas attacks - now he is in poverty.

item.title: Jordan North speaks out after sudden Radio 1 exit
item.description: The presenter thanks his listeners and says he will miss his "partner in crime", Vick Hope.

item.title: Harrison Ford's Star Wars script sells for £10,000 at auction
item.description: The pages had been left in a west London flat the actor rented in the 1970s.

item.title: HS2 Chiltern Tunnel sinkholes appear in Buckinghamshire
item.description: The craters are discovered on private land, within months of two others being found nearby.

item.title: Donald Trump hit where it hurts most in New York fraud ruling
item.description: A scathing judgment limits the former president's ability to do business in the city where he made his name.

item.title: 'Zombie Fires' burning at an alarming rate in Canada
item.description: Canada's wildfire season is not over, with dozens of winter fires still burning beneath the soil.

item.title: Japan: Defence ministry eases haircut rules for troops
item.description: Changes to hair length regulations will come into effect in April in a bid to attract new recruits.

item.title: Moment surprise party is accidentally revealed on BBC News
item.description: BBC Weather's Kawser Quamer went into a bit too much detail in her forecast on North West Tonight.

item.title: Tata Steel workers protest over proposed job losses
item.description: Protests were held in Newport and Port Talbot - where major Tata sites are based.

item.title: Fans get rare chance to see Billy Connolly's 'Big Banana Feet'
item.description: The 1975 documentary was discovered on eBay and will now be screened in the cinema again.

item.title: Week in pictures: 10-16 February 2024
item.description: A selection of striking images from around the world, taken over the past seven days.

item.title: Lancaster University: Students unable to afford food for days, union says
item.description: A student union leader says the situation for some is "desperate" as they are "at breaking point".

item.title: Newhaven: Person charged after migrants found in lorry
item.description: Six people were taken to hospital after migrants were found in a lorry aboard a ferry in Sussex.

item.title: Manchester United: Harry Styles watches Rasmus Hojlund take centre stage in win at Luton
item.description: Harry Styles provides a sprinkle of stardust at Luton but Manchester United are left celebrating their own latest headline act in Rasmus Hojlund.

item.title: Six Nations: England's Alex Mitchell ruled out of Scotland match with knee injury
item.description: England scrum-half Alex Mitchell will miss the Six Nations match against Scotland with a knee injury.

item.title: Leah Williamson: Arsenal defender withdraws from England squad with injury
item.description: Leah Williamson withdraws from her first England squad since April after injuring her hamstring.

item.title: F1 wants Horner allegations 'clarified at earliest opportunity'
item.description: Formula 1 urges Red Bull to resolve the controversy surrounding team principal Christian Horner "as soon as possible".

item.title: Kane goal not enough as Bayern suffer third defeat in nine days
item.description: England captain Harry Kane's late goal at Bochum is not enough as Bayern Munich suffer their third defeat in nine days.

item.title: Match of the Day 2: How Man Utd's Rasmus Hojlund provided 'complete performance'
item.description: Match of the Day 2's Mark Chapman, Alan Shearer & Leon Osman analyse Rasmus Hojlund's "complete performance" in Manchester United's 2-1 win at Luton.

item.title: Michael J Fox brings people to tears in Baftas surprise appearance
item.description: The actor, who lives with Parkinson's disease, got up from his wheelchair to present best film award.

item.title: Baftas 2024 highlights: The big winners... in two minutes
item.description: Laughter and tears for winners at the Bafta Awards 2024 in London.

item.title: Baftas red carpet in pictures: Stars turn on style at British film awards
item.description: Big names from films like Barbie, Oppenheimer and Saltburn step out at the British awards ceremony.

item.title: Baftas 2024: The moments you might have missed
item.description: A dog almost stole the show, Da'Vine Joy Randolph made Chiwetel Ejiofor blush and Hugh Grant nailed it.

item.title: Bafta Awards 2024: The complete list of winners and nominees
item.description: See all the winners from this year's Bafta Film Awards, which have been taking place in London.

item.title: Alexei Navalny: Supporters' grief, defiance and hope after leader's death
item.description: In a country where dissent has been silenced, just laying flowers is an act of courage, writes Steve Rosenberg.

item.title: Alexei Navalny: Tributes and arrests as Russians mark opposition leader's death
item.description: Across the country people have been forcibly taken away for leaving flowers and tributes for the deceased political activist.

item.title: Alexei Navalny was often asked: ‘Do you fear for your life?'
item.description: Sarah Rainsford on how Putin's opponent never abandoned his belief in "the beautiful Russia of the future".

item.title: What we know about reports of Navalny's death
item.description: Many believe the opposition leader paid the ultimate price for opposing Putin - what do we know?

item.title: Watch: Navalny's moments of defiance
item.description: See key moments in Alexei Navalny's career as an outspoken critic of President Putin.

item.title: Putin must be held accountable - Yulia Navalnaya
item.description: Alexei Navalny's wife says Vladimir Putin "will be brought to justice", after her husband was reported to have died in prison.

item.title: In his own words - dark humour during dark times
item.description: The opposition leader was famed for his dry wit which he often directed at Putin.

item.title: BBC Russia Editor: News will worsen Russia-West relations
item.description: News of Alexei Navalny's death will worsen relations between Russia and the west, Steve Rosenberg says.

item.title: Russia's most vociferous Putin critic
item.description: Russian anti-corruption campaigner Alexei Navalny was the main opposition threat to the Kremlin.

item.title: Watch Yulia Navalnaya speak following report of husband Alexei's death
item.description: Yulia Navalnaya tells a conference in Munich she doesn't know whether the "horrible news" is true.

item.title: John Curtice: Results leave Tories with mountain to climb
item.description: Polling expert Prof Sir John Curtice says the party will be worried by the scale of its defeats by Labour.

item.title: Tory members would choose me as leader, says Nigel Farage
item.description: Reform UK's co-founder predicts he will end up in the same party as Tory MPs like Sir Jacob Rees-Mogg.

item.title: Sunak: Mid-term by-elections always difficult for governments
item.description: The PM says there were “particularly challenging” circumstances in two-by-elections his party lost to Labour.

item.title: General election: When is the next one and who decides?
item.description: A UK general election has to be held by 28 January 2025, but could take place earlier.

item.title: Watch: New Labour MP for Kingswood thanks voters
item.description: Labour has overturned a large Conservative majority to win the Kingswood by-election.

item.title: Gen Kitchen: Labour Party ‘ready’ to serve UK people
item.description: New Wellingborough MP Gen Kitchen tells her supporters she's "delighted", after her by-election victory.

item.title: Could Reform UK surge sink Tory election hopes?
item.description: The former Brexit Party scored its best ever by-election results as Labour seized two safe Tory seats.
